results.title: Live Updates: Netanyahu and Hezbollah Trade Fresh Threats
results.abstract: The Israeli leader vowed to take “whatever action is necessary” to diminish the threat posed by Hezbollah. A senior official with the militant group warned that an overnight barrage of missiles against Israel was “just the beginning.”

results.title: A French Fair as Workers’ Paradise, Feting Cuisine, Music and Communism
results.abstract: The Fête de l’Humanité, a blend of Burning Man, Woodstock and a political convention, attracts the masses with bands, lectures and food, but here K.F.C. is C.F.K.: Communist Fried Kitchen.

multimedia.caption: The Fête de l’Humanité, a popular festival on the outskirts of Paris, celebrates left-wing politics in general, and French Communism in particular.

results.title: U.N. Meets Amid a Backdrop of Growing Chaos and Violence
results.abstract: Beginning Tuesday, world leaders will discuss three wars, climate change, rising sea levels and proposals to expand representation on the Security Council.
geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

results.title: For Mideast Foes, Diplomacy Takes a Back Seat to Military Force
results.abstract: After years of failed deals and tit-for-tat violence, neither the Israelis nor the Palestinians believe their adversaries will ever negotiate in good faith.

results.title: The German Chancellor’s Party Ekes Out a Win Over the Far Right
results.abstract: The narrow win by Olaf Scholz’s party came in a state election, the third in a series that was seen as a reflection of the national mood and a snapshot of the government’s popularity.

results.title: Leftist Leader Elected President as Sri Lanka Rejects the Old Order
results.abstract: Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s strong showing reveals voter weariness with leadership that has led to a national economic crisis and crushing hardship for many people.
results.byline: By Mujib Mashal and Pamodi Waravita

results.abstract: The Old Forge on the rugged peninsula of Knoydart is a community-owned meeting point for locals and visitors — at least those willing to trek across the wilderness.

results.title: What to Watch For in a Key German State Election
results.abstract: The far right and far left are poised to make significant gains in state voting on Sunday, possibly affecting the stability of the national government in Berlin.

results.abstract: At least 129 people died when inmates tried to escape from Makala Prison, where conditions are abysmal and overcrowding is a major problem.

results.title: Explosion at an Iranian Mine Kills Dozens, State Media Says
results.abstract: A methane leak set off the explosion, the country’s official media said, and a rescue effort was underway for those believed to be trapped in the mine.

results.title: Heavy Rain in Japan Causes Deadly Flooding and Landslides
results.abstract: One person is dead and seven others are missing in Noto Peninsula, Japanese news media reported. The region is still recovering from a catastrophic earthquake.

results.title: Albania Is Planning a New Muslim State Inside Its Capital
